item.description:
The Millyard Museum is 9!
Birthday Party and Open House
Saturday, April 17
At the Millyard Museum
10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.
FREE Admission

Join the Manchester Historic Association as we celebrate the
Millyard Museum’s 9th birthday and the 150th anniversary of
Abraham Lincoln’s visit to Manchester on March 1, 1860!

Enjoy a full day of activities at the Millyard Museum:

10:00 a.m. – “Blacks in Manchester in the 19th Century” talk by Rick Tyson, University of New Hampshire student and MHA intern. Mr. Tyson will present information he recently uncovered regarding the black population of Manchester before, during and after the period of the Civil War.

11:15 a.m. – The 12th NHV Serenade Band will perform Civil War-era music in period costume, playing on authentic instruments from the period.

1:15 p.m. – The 12th NHV Serenade Band will return for a second performance.

2:30 p.m. - Birthday Party for the Millyard Museum and reception to honor our volunteers - everyone is invited!
item.name: The Millyard Museum is 9! Birthday Party and Open House
